Questions.questionText: Which of three persuasive strategies does the author rely on most heavily in this text?

Questions.questionText:
Which of the following sentences illustrate the author’s use
of evocative language? Select all that apply.

answers.answerText: The Times reported that having a job at Amazon means 80-hour working weeks, fierce competition among co-workers, and punishingly critical performance reviews.
answers.feedBack: That is correct! In each sentence, the author creates a strong emotional response in the reader with words like “fierce” and “punishingly”, “eliminated”, and “world domination”.

answers.answerText: Employees are ranked, and those at the bottom each year are eliminated.
answers.feedBack: That is correct! In each sentence, the author creates a strong emotional response in the reader with words like “fierce” and “punishingly”, “eliminated”, and “world domination”.

answers.answerText: The company is said to be working on using drones to deliver packages within 30 minutes of purchase. If it succeeds, its world domination will be complete.
answers.feedBack: That is correct! In each sentence, the author creates a strong emotional response in the reader with words like “fierce” and “punishingly”, “eliminated”, and “world domination”.
